d9sM0fpTEo2o5wplEmiwhw.text: Yummy sandwiches, great coffee and a fantastic space! It's my go to spot for meeting friends, doing a little work.

6kuZSVOaYLVbm4-74mT4GQ.text: Stopped here after bicycling Open Pittsburgh today. DELIGHTFULLY surprised, fresh, fresh food. Friendly, don't hesitate to return.

cahrncFQP1gIhTIJkaNk9A.text: I came by the cafe with family and friends in early December and was delighted! The food was delicious, the staff was extremely friendly and we never felt rushed. Definitely a hidden Pittsburgh gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

7NkKidGw90Ie9BLDo6C7Hg.text: This place is fantastic. You should drop everything and go to Pear and the Pickle immediately.  The food is fantastic--house-made bacon, anyone?--and the ambiance, from the decor to Bobby's welcoming smile, makes this place a winner.  I'm so happy to see such a great independently-owned cafe open up here.

8UGMhO9TCHTv2CS8JBf7GQ.text: Wow, who knew a place like this was in Troy Hill? I was inspired to come here by a picture of their breakfast sandwich that I saw on instagram (#millenial). It is like your perfect Pinterest coffee shop fantasy in this place. The coffee was delicious and the breakfast sandwich was amazing, and I appreciated the toys they had to keep my 1 year old occupied.

iBJD-UwCgY3cN9pZ2AI1sQ.text: I came to this place while hiking on the Three Rivers Heritage Trail.  Now I will warn you, you have to cross a highway and climb a giant hill to get to it.  But it was worth it!    The place feels like a cozy house to me.  The colors are really cool and there are several different rooms.  Also there are lots of outlets available.  I got the grilled chicken sandwich and it was very yummy.  Also the waiter was very friendly and helpful.  :)  I really enjoyed this cafe; it was just what I wanted!

IREq5jEHZgMf9RDhrF74ww.text: Bacon, egg, and cheese on the softest bun. Stumptown coffee. Tasty other offerings! Great owners, awesome to have this gem in Troy Hill. Everyone should go.  Update: still awesome. Now with homemade sausage and biscuits.

mQmCXuQUSNb20Twl2x65Wg.text: So happy to see this cute cafe pop up on Rialto street! Delicious sandwiches and great atmosphere - and who doesn't love Boar's Head meat! This little shop is exactly what Troy Hill needs!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

rQCOe4XtigVuNX9zKkmhHA.text: New favorite spot! The best breakfast sandwich in town, IMHO, serving tasty Stumptown coffee to boot in a rustic, cute cafe setting full of refurbished tables and chairs. Friendly staff as well and an overall warm hometown vibe. Plus, plenty of street parking nearby. Definitely check em out, it's well worth the steep drive up Rialto off SR28!

cyYeigFZhOZag_VfGAtmng.text: Pear and the Pickle is a welcome addition to Troy Hill.  My coworkers and I often grab afternoon coffee here in lieu of the office Keurig - can't go wrong with Stumptown. I've tried the veggie sandwich and the bacon + egg + cheese and they were both yummy.   I also like that they sell cat litter.

0N0WBO-2fEjwNde-oHpkJw.text: The absolute worst service I have ever encountered in my life! We were ignored and mocked by the smug barista. After that, I actually felt intimidated by who I assume was the owner. Expresso machine equipment was aggressively slammed while we waited. This was my third time going there and there certainly will never be a fourth.

IxlMtyQ_6ABF8ZXcIkXeyg.text: Fantastic place! Beautiful ambiance with several rooms of space. Great tables and chairs for groups or individuals. And the food! The Rialto was soooo delicious! Full of great seasonings and lots of meat and veggies. And the full size is enormous! The granola with fruit super generous too.  I would even say you get way more than you pay for. Super fresh food. And even out door patio too! Totally will be coming back!!!

DKHXCpcSQV-gO8H-BJK7AA.text: Visited today for the first time.  It's absolutely my new favorite coffee shop in the city.  Beautiful decor, great ambiance and the coffee and food are delicious.  Everyone is super friendly, as well.  They also have games available to play, which is always a plus! Definitely a must try!

hSZLKXWYwe7b1zEGG96TYA.text: Super cute eclectic cafe, great quality food & drinks, very friendly staff, the atmosphere makes you want to sit down and hang out for a while. I look forward to coming back and mingling with the locals often. My only gripe is I wish they had longer hours.

YVBL2lNA-6zaVBExspEB8w.text: Had the good fortune of stumbling upon this place on my ride to work and I am so glad I stopped. Delicious latte and their sausage, egg, cheese, and tomato is my new pick for best breakfast sandwich in the city. Also I just really love the look of the place. Super cozy. Their decorator did an A+ job. Good music. Good service.

FEQh5NEqu8M8208hzvdqLA.text: The Yelp reviews about breakfast sandwiches brought us in. The service, house coffee, atmosphere, and market will keep us coming back. The breakfast sandwiches are as good as the reviews say they are! The deli and market of essential items will be great for a quick grocery run after work.

A7JM7BG-Ik3SqTrIxI54zw.text: One of the best egg and bacon sandwiches I've ever eaten. (I added a lot of toppings, including tomatoes and garlic aioli.)  Fresh ingredients and made with care.  Mocha was also delicious.

USVfC2P0sqvlwpL-eDrz5Q.text: This little place is adorable! It's got a very Lawrenceville hipster vibe and fast friendly service.  The sausage egg and cheese sandwich was delicious and super filling.  My boyfriend ordered a 6 inch hoagie that was stuffed to the brim with enough meat and cheese to fill a 12 inch.  Will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh cut flowers on a Saturday morning.

wsjWo-9gFkaCaZe7jI974A.text: we absolutely love pear & the pickle!  nothing beats a well-made breakfast sandwich, and every element of theirs are on point.  also, you can purchase bags of stumptown coffee while you're here!   they give you a complimentary cup of coffee when you buy a bag.  they are able to do a really good coarse grind of the beans for french press users.  we always end up lingering inside because the environment in the cafe is just so warm and inviting.  definitely a morning favorite!

PDA7S7innimp2NU_rFhKPQ.text: We had some major problems with service when we went, but our food was good. We may come back to try again and hopefully give a better rating.

utys7dEdRxFCQji5KBjFJw.text: Oh my gawd!! So good. Went here for breakfast and their breakfast sandwich is crave-worthy.   The space deserves mention as well. It is spacious and  cozy. Wouldn't mind spending a good chunk of time here. I will be back fo sho.

J7Gtkec7mMX86VNs2EVU9w.text: Just the cutest little spot. Located on top of Troy Hill (yes, up Rialto St) sits the most quaint and warm coffee shop/eatery in the city. It feels like you're transported about 80 years into the past (in all the right reasons); the Pear and Pickle feels like you're joining a friend in their parlor for a coffee and breakfast. I just love the aesthetic, not to mention they retained the original built-ins in what used to be the old home's dining room. And you bet it's stocked with antique place settings. Onto the food. My gosh. The burgers here were quite tasty. I got the regular burger will all the fixings. It definitely didn't disappoint, especially with Mancini buns-oooh weee!!! Grilled with butter--always a win! We happened to stop in when Roundabout Brewery was doing a pop-up, so we were able to pair our burger with a delicious beer. Definitely will return--anxious to try their breakfast sammich.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Beautiful flowers and atmosphere
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. blueberry buckle and espresso
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon egg and cheese sammich

EIURSa27ipItK9ujm9fAcw.text: The food is always fresh and consistent!  The staff is friendly and helpful.  In the warmer weather they will have outdoor seating on the roof! I can't wait to eat up there with the view! The homemade desserts never disappoints and the grocery stock is convenient for we locals who forgot something in the middle of cooking dinner.  The prices are very reasonable priced for the portion size and quality. It's great to have such a wonderful restaurant a few blocks from home!  They are now open on Sundays!  I have nothing but great things to say about The Pear and Pickle!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

BvEBHWqWNQ8-orYInQCL1Q.text: This spot is great!  I am a huge, personal, fan of Bobby and the staff that work here.  I just devoured some delicious chocolate chunk cookies and my second cup of coffee (Stumptown FTW). I've enjoyed their breakfast sandwiches, as well as a few pop-up food evenings that were quite spectacular. I have always felt like I am tasting quality ingredients, surrounded by a gorgeous atmosphere.  Thanks so much! Nom.

n4YwcrlekaqJIFB-_j6cmg.text: This place is so charming and out of another era. It seems like an old fashioned market. There are three different seating sections. The one in the back has seating for 2-3 people at each table. One of the tables is the bottom of an old foot powered sewing machine. The middle section has a book and game shelf and has a larger table with beautiful fresh flowers.  The front of the store, where you order, has plenty of charm and sunshine.  The menu is one chalk boards above the counter. They serve breakfast all day. Their hours are short but the food is very good.  I've gotten both a custom ordered sandwich and breakfast sandwich.  They have a really selection of fresh breads and cheeses which I appreciate.  Come here for simple but good meal. They have a wonderful selection of homemade desserts and cakes as well as ice cream sandwiches.  The fellow behind the counter is all business. Meaning he's not a ray of sunshine but I can overlook it as he has never been rude and the place is otherwise amazing.  It's so good I've brought friends.

ySDmr6tBhPGD1I7Ms0pjKQ.text: What a great addition to Troy Hill! This little gem is very reflective of the neighborhood itself-- hidden, adorable and super friendly! The atmosphere is one of the best parts about PATP. The interior is very simple, yet still has a modern rustic feel to it. It's also a lot bigger than you'd expect. There are three separate rooms to eat and hang, a mini grocery store with lots of basic and not so basic items and of course the kitchen. Everything is cooked right behind the counter.  I had a chicken sandwich and it was awesome! Not only was it delicious, but probably one of the biggest chicken sandwiches I've ever eaten in my life. They garnish it with the right toppings! The menu is what you'd expect-- sandwiches, salads, chips, etc. Prices are a little higher, but for the amount of food it's well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great for quick buys!

WMXD4DhNNYaQu3AXUN7wAQ.text: Came here after going to the St Andrews church for a tour, but before our next tour of a funky, hidden German art house that is right around the corner from this place.    This place has good coffee and giant peanut butter jelly sandwiches for 4.50!   They've got bright, clean ( gender binary ) bathrooms, and a little library for adults and children. The aesthetic here feels hipster, and I love that.

31085Xk6ysYiejJp_CxEuA.text: Maybe it's the Stumptown, maybe the books, but Pear and the Pickle reminds me of Portland.  Pear and the Pickel is one of the few places in Pittsburgh that has good lunch, no table service, and is quiet enough to think.

mXVvjAn1mler951XXfcp7g.text: This place is wonderful. Very friendly staff and quick service. The food is fresh and the coffee is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4YDfaBBP_yWdGUnYXeII0A.text: Great little hideout. Hip, bright restaurant/coffee shop with good tunes, good food, books, boardgames, and newspapers to enjoy. I will definitely return

SVm8A-luhL7cFAeT6XYjVQ.text: This place is too cute! Love love the market vibe with cool artwork, flowers on the windowsill, books and games, and good music.   I got the Reuben (that day's special) and told myself I was going to take half to go, which was a total lie. I ate the whole thing and enjoyed every bite! Definitely made with quality ingredients & love. Also got a house drip coffee which came with a free refill. Yum.  Came here to get some work done, which there is plenty of space to do. I do wish it was open later, but maybe I should just wake up earlier... Had some trouble connecting to the Wifi and they were SO helpful! I've been places before where they're like 'oh well, we're not tech experts!' which I get, but it bums me out when I'm trying to be productive and can't. Anyways, they checked in on me a few minutes after I got the internet password and I explained it wasn't working. Then they fiddled around a bit, came back over and helped me connect to another network. They were super apologetic, understanding and overall just cool. Real people helping real people!!   Thank you! I will definitely be back to hang out more!

xwjdwsOHJgRL50uSRBOZRg.text: Very cool place, great set up, friendly owners. Tasty breakfast sandwich. They have an espresso machine and teas. They also serve lunch sandwiches which I will have to go back for. They also have a rooftop area where you can sit and enjoy your breakfast or lunch. Sometimes they serve dinner. Love little places in the middle of neighborhoods. Cheers to The Pear and the Pickle.

7iy9mdQQj8hj_sD0zqw9Bw.text: Very cute place. However, after I spent $30 for my family and gave 25% tip I asked for an extra piece of cheese for my 2 year old son who obviously doesn't like to wait, and was charged .80 cents......Seriously?

b0aZsmP900PSYfsvWYeNOQ.text: Hidden gem. I am a lover of sandwiches and this place does them right! Breakfast or regular you can't go wrong. The moment you walk in you can smell and see them cooking on the grill right behind you, often the owners themselves. They have great coffee and teas with house made syrups that are just so good. It's very homey and they have a large selection of complimentary books to read as well as some household items for sale. A nice and thought out assortment of seating, which I appreciate. I am also excited to try a dinner series there this year!

I3SrjEyb7Cy0lfsuI7-mzw.text: Such poor customer service. We were so excited to try something new, however The owners and employees are some of the rudest we have ever encountered. We absolutely did not feel welcomed to even place an order at 1:15pm when they closed at 2, to make food that took a total of 5 minutes to prepare. The comments were crude and they rushed us once we walked in. My husband and I will be sure to NOT return and I wouldn't recommend this cafe to anyone.

mL56Eqp_nnDElne7CanOWg.text: My boyfriend and I were passing through town and found this place. We were not disappointed to stumble into this local neighborhood gem. Great food, good coffee and a cozy, eclectic atmosphere made for a positive experience. Highly recommend Pear and the Pickle.

GmYkteUiV97G252kYUPJ-g.text: Sneaky pleasant little cafe while passing through. Ole general store feel, with updated atmosphere. Tremendously tastey Reuben mounds of corned beef. My wife had a tuna melt delicious just the right blend of ingredients tons of flavors and with fresh tomatoes in the spring were fantastic. Pickles were delicious. Iced wildssweet orange teas full of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Deliciously dark but smooth cold brew coffee
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best Reuben

N-TyTkmjP97zTRinBz23hA.text: As time has gone on, I've become more and more selective about my 5 star ratings. In this case, there was no doubt that this is a great cafe, well-deserving of a top tier rating. First, the neighborhood: it's great to see a place like this in Troy Hill and Pittsburgh. The atmosphere is Pinterest-perfect, magazine ready, and comfortable. It was full, but not crowded. Bustling, but not loud. Iron & Wine, one of my favorites, was playing on the stereo while I was there so they get a star just for that. The coffee was quite good and you get a free refill. The breakfast sammie was stellar, really everything you could ask for in a sandwich, but the star of the show was the bacon tho.  All in all, this is the kind of place I'll take people when I want to show them what this town is capable of.

EerghqVFoNfIr6wZHGqZxg.text: After reading all of the positive reviews, we headed here for breakfast. The cafe itself is very cute and is a nice size, with 3 adjoining rooms. The food was also very tasty, my cappuccino delicious. Why 3 stars? Customer service in this business should be stellar. The woman behind the counter was just plain rude. She actually appeared to be angry when I asked a few questions. Maybe she was just having a bad morning, but if you're dealing one on one with customers, you need to do a better job at faking that you enjoy you're job.

3_6VQn6KC2csuo9Nt3th_w.text: LITERALLY my favorite place in Pittsburgh.  My friends and I go weekly to get their delicious egg sandwiches and lattes.  All of their food is so so good, the service is excellent, and the owners are so friendly and delightful.   Also, they have a burger night once a month which has one of the best burgers in the city!

qGBontVIDEScDv8Lg8r8BA.text: Sandwiches... AMAZING .. soup.. AMAZING... customer service ..AHHMAZINGGGGGG. First time being here but definitely not my last. New favorite breakfast spot when I'm in town definitely ! Keep the good breakfast coming.

eWgeCcJLIUy5pBkdlEqmCQ.text: Great find on Troy Hill. Excellent spot for a sandwich - or a breakfast egg sandwich. I personally recommend the portobello sandwich. My friend Rob give the Rielto sandwich five stars. Definitely worth the drive up the hill

Xum5aZ9bcT63NahYGkM3gg.text: Without experiencing the Coffee Passport, we would've never known this place existed. We enjoyed the vibe and were impressed by the line at 9 am at opening time. Pretty cool across the board.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Wf4PVKOB2rP9K1AxAjWYaA.text: Owner is originally from Michigan and spent some time in Brooklyn, just about 15 years. Found this gem in a tiny pocket of Pittsburgh's under rated neighborhood, Troy Hill. Perched on the hilltop, this neighborhood has been getting some hot spots. Hipster and locals alike merge here.    Having lunch and love it. Kitchy and very Pittsburgh eclectic, your grandmother's plates but no Islay's chipped chopped ham.   Great sandwiches and awesome soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Red Lentil Soup
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Troy Hill, Turkey and Swiss
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Corned Beef -takes a week to make!!

tFHN_LrRxmo7suou1RCKJw.text: What a GEM! Everything about this place is perfect! From the vintage decor to the board games available to play , the atmosphere is incredibly inviting. The food is absolutely delicious!!! Sweet lady at the register is always up for chatting and answering my questions about what to order.  The breakfast sandwiches , the Reuben & the coffee cake are my favorites. You must go for burger night!!!! Absolutely one of my most favorite spots in the Burgh.

VDY2RREUG0rKqmAcs-VKEQ.text: Great atmosphere, fantastic egg sandwich. The coffee was amazing as well. Great little breakfast joint. Give it a try, you won't regret it.

JFN_At8TKPTIMSoFd6Zk2g.text: Was here last Sunday for breakfast.  The blueberry cake and bacon/egg sandwich was amazing.  Charming atmosphere in a nice neighborhood.  Very clean and great place to take kids as they have games you can play while you wait.  We did have to wait for our food as there were several orders ahead of ours but the wait was worth it!  Highly recommend!

5cxbf0V1R0sAja_hyJW_YQ.text: What a cute place! Bigger than expected from the outside, and I enjoyed how they reuse older modern objects into furniture.   Great coffee, and treats to eat. The prices were reasonable, and it's one of the few spots around Troy Hill that's open during the day.   It was a nice refreshing walk to experience the smaller aspects of a city like Pittsburgh.  Bravo.

PVCQRVBRdXjJWsWouLNo5g.text: I love this place. The coffee is delicious. The food is incredible. The staff is great.

4Ja35X4ZhjJkOR53KxJ6cw.text: This place is super cute and the food is delicious. I had a breakfast sandwich and coffee and both were made with fresh ingredients and were very delicious. They also have a deli counter with prices that are about spot-on with the grocery stores.   The space is "farmer/rustic chic" and very cozy and welcoming. The space is pretty large with ample seating. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese breakfast sandwich with coffee.

cQk5_w_0n5lQtrl7AWZRkA.text: I was really looking forward to trying the seitan melt after my husband raved it to me about it but was disappointed to find out the brand they use is not vegetarian (Mancinis uses lard) and they don't have any vegan cheese options. I was able to have a delicious salad with seitan and Portabella on top! The employees were not very friendly or accommodating either. Hoping to go back again and get a seitan sandwich someday!!

xZ5RMynAGFD3oEdGBAwxhQ.text: We have the coffee passport, and this was one of the better ones!!! They give you good options to choose from, a lot of cool pictures and art, also there food looked amazing! Everyone was super nice too! Defiantly recommended it for others!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cappuccino

dJA-m116BbPv3JgGOumAjA.text: The Pear and Pickle has been here for 2 years now, and they continue to earn loyal customers. They keep their customers by providing delicious food prepared from scratch. Like the biscuit, egg and cheese sandwiches we bought today. Remarkably satisfying meals served up with a smile.   The multi-room dining space is clean, comfortable, and welcoming. There are spaces for groups, places to read a book, spots to work from a laptop.   If you want to get to know the owners, they are eager to welcome and get to know you. Community is present here, and you are invited to be a part of it.   It's a unique place, and you can tell I love everything about it. The owner was planning on selling more groceries, but is moving more towards focusing on the food and beverages.   Oh, but the desserts! Make sure you leave some space for the amazing sweet treats. Really great cookies, cakes and pies.   The only thing left to say is to not put off your visit here any longer!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage egg cheese
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spinach salad (substituted with field greens)
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pesto pasta

ddv5QGHCUMJVFAwXyhG3Bg.text: Delicious breakfast sandwich, smooth iced vanilla latte and creamy hot chocolate. We will definitely go back. Plus it's a cute environment in a quaint little neighborhood.

K58Gn4PZjlfMCdwYm5G_TA.text: Pear and the pickle is the perfect hybrid between a market and cafe set inside the setting of what seems to be have been a house.  The deli menu on the day we went consisted of tuna sandwiches and reubens, and we went with the reubans, while I also got a cappuccino. The reubans were delightful and did not take too long.  There are three separate rooms with space for seating. One room holds a bookcase of books to read and games to play. Furniture and walls are very reminiscent of home--even with cases filled with china/fine plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside looking in
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cute flower display
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Reuben with cappucino

qMj-ccPNEaIhAIYlwFcTBw.text: I love this cafe. It has a lot of table space, great food and coffee. I really enjoyed my tomato soup and grilled cheese during my last visit.   I also appreciate that they carry Millie's and Leona's ice cream sandwiches. It has some staple grocery items, like pasta and even laundry detergent. It's a neighborhood gem. I can't wait to check it out again in the summer.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled cheese and tomato soup with coffee

d7r7VVtIW76ItTFdxF2EGw.text: The food & drinks were good - nothing awesome. Unfortunately the experience was overshadowed by the employee who was rude and impatient as we navigated the menu & he took our order. While the Pear & the Pickle came recommended to us, I wouldn't recommend it (I also wouldn't say don't go - nothing was bad). We won't make a point to visit again. The whole experience was unimpressive.

-6pUGp17fy3yo76_Xyf8OA.text: My third time trying out this cafe was disappointing enough to not want to come back. The breakfast sandwiches were ok the first two times. The chai tea was not worth returning for. This cafe is close to home so I came back a third time to find an extremely long line with 3 people behind the counter. 2 of whom were arguing and visibly annoyed. I waited in line watching the 2 bicker. When I was second in line, the man rudely asked what the person wanted and in my opinion, was unprofessional. I did not feel like eating food prepared by disgruntled workers and wait even longer for the food to be prepared. I walked out hungry.

8O_hpcGW49wVWdGeegfjgw.text: First visit today. My Troy Hill Turkey was delicious. All four other companions loved it too. A welcoming, unpretentious space. Many great conversations. A neighborhood gathering spot. Wish I had one in my anonymous suburb. I would be there everyday. Many thanks.

Rq6zaL_HGrKzCxdqtD2yuw.text: As the owner of a coffee shop, I really appreciate owner/operated businesses like this one.  Charming, inviting and the best BLT around.  Smooth Americano.  Will be a regular myself.  My son, and barista, was mad I came without him!

HWxZsv69TKfRLcSoL_KBig.text: Great small cafe with fresh homemade sandwiches, a daily soup, and great baked goods and locally roasted coffee.

nyR12NI48JtfjwOfRIxygg.text: I've been wanting to try this place out for a long time and I finally got an opportunity to do so. It appears to be a reconverted first floor house with a small selection of groceries in the front. They serve both breakfast and lunch here along with Stumpton's fresh roasted coffee. I decided to opt for a turkey Reuben and a small chocolate chip cookie. They do offer an all vegetarian sandwich.  I also went for a spiced iced tea which had a bit of a zing to it. After I ordered I was told to wait until they called me by name. It gave me a chance to explore the place. In the center area is a beautiful dining room table and behind it is a wall full of children's books and games. In the back room were more cafe tables for people who were working. There was also some seating in the front area.  I got my food on a lovely dish you would get visiting someone's house. I ate in the big dining room just to soak in the atmosphere. All the chairs surrounding the table were different. On to the food. The turkey Reuben was moist and I enjoyed it thoroughly. The small chocolate chip cookie I got to go with it seemed dry and reminded me of a store bought brand. Still it is a nice place to check out when you are in the Troy Hill neighborhood. Parking can be difficult since only street parking is available.  They were selling the coffee by the bag and I learned that it was not flavored. It smelled good so definitely want to check that out on my next visit.   I didn't price the groceries since there wasn't much of a selection. Next time I visit will opt for a breakfast sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Turkey Reuben and a chocolate chip cookie
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Groceries
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Stumptown coffee

JNvLCcj-C-TUhD0jMDZEYQ.text: Delish. D-Lish. The bread makes a sandwich, this place has awesome bread. Beyond the bread everything else is awesome. Had a turkey sub with pickles, lettuce, aioli, american: awesome sandwich.  Plus the owner profusely apologized for not being allowed to have dogs inside. Which to me is the sign of a kindred spirit. We'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qzlWSa1PL7uK6lr8Z7l5Yg.text: Stop #2 on our passport did not let me down! We arrived right as they opened which was good because it got busy super fast. This shop doesn't roast their own, but they brew a good cup of coffee. They also make perhaps the best breakfast sandwich in Pittsburgh! It's a little out of the way for us, but worth the trip up Troy Hill!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yf_DCUe_ymS-eAT3RE9odA.text: Very spacious dine-in but it can still be packed on a weekend. The egg sandwich is delicious, I highly recommend it. Do not buy an iced coffee. I though it was a fluke that my iced coffe was 60% water, 20% ice and 20% coffee. I went back this morning (a few months later) and grabbed one, it was worse. I actually threw it away. Great sandwich horrible iced coffee.

8uSvQGsj9hjnC9oDevZxTQ.text: This place has by far the best breakfast sandwich you'll ever eat! It is A perfect place for a quick breakfast or brunch date. The shop is super unique and cozy. They also make amazing lunch sandwiches as well, that also never disappoint. If you are a breakfast sandwich  fan... This is the place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage egg and cheese
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sausage egg and cheese and a meatloaf sandwich
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Biscuit egg Sammy

kDoIRU0ahmnQ2v4fvJb19Q.text: Cute little cafe. Loved the old sewing machine tables! Food was excellent! Love Boar's Head brand sandwiches. Theirs were very creative. Wasn't sure if we could order something besides what was on the chalkboards though. The teas, both iced and hot were very good. Would love to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Got chicken sandwich
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Troy Hill Turkey Sandwich
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Roast Beef

GIuZVOn_nTPE38ONh69eqQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try this place out forever and finally made our way over. It's a cute little cafe/sandwich shop. I got a chai tea w/ soy milk and he got the americano, both were pretty standard. We also got the 6" turkey sandwich to split. At first I was a little taken back by that price ($8 for the sandwich) but it was phenomenal! Loaded with delicious turkey and Swiss with added house made aioli. Totally worth it! Filled us both up for lunch.  The space is really cool too. Most of the tables are long so you might sit next to a stranger which worked for us because we got to talking to people and had a nice conversation. Definitely has that neighborhood feel and I can't wait to go back!

4t8J1NrBHzJJCPNNujdHfQ.text: Finally had the chance to try this little eclectic spot. It was a Saturday morning a little before 11am. We walked in and you order at the counter with the menu above. My husband and I both ordered what people rave about- the breakfast sandwiches, and they did not disappoint. Soft bread, egg with a runny yolk, peppered thick bacon, it was the perfect combination- my husband who's more of the breakfast sandwich connoisseur said it was one of the best sandwiches he's ever had. I also got the cold brewed coffee- sourced from Stumptown in Portland and that was delicious. The space is very light and bright, but I'd recommend grabbing a table before it's gone, it got busier as we were there and we had to sit in a back room.

zHIUsxqRe8ZzCcn5Cmfbxg.text: After hearing many good things about this breakfast spot I couldn't wait to try the breakfast sandwiches. This weekend was my third time back!  The cafe is along a small street, and you could easily miss it if you weren't looking for it. There wasn't a line, but the tables were full. We ordered two breakfast sandwiches and fruit, granola and berries. We had coffee and an americano while we waited for our breakfast. They offer a variety of cafe drinks. We loved the sandwiches. I had mine on a homemade biscuit. The biscuit was a little too much bread for my preference, but still very tasty. The granola seemed to be homemade as well.   The service there was quick and we really enjoyed hanging at the farm tables. The environment is really inviting and cozy. Along with fresh flowers, they have many books, board games and newspapers available while you are there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

vDHMVZkqu5GKG4rGEIEMMA.text: This cafe is truly a gem and it's quickly becoming my favorite breakfast spot in the burgh. It's cute. It's chill. It's a great hang-out spot.   I've been here for brunch and lunch and I've gotten to try their breakfast sandwiches, the tuna melt, and the veggie melt. I don't think you can go wrong here. Everything I tried was filling and delicious. They are definitely serving up some of the best sandwiches in the city.   Bonus points for offering Stumptown coffee and Leona's ice cream sandwiches. I'm in love.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best ice cream sandwiches in the history of the world!
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The interior is delightful.

qkJuJPEnXZh8zpualO-rNw.text: Visited Pear and the Pickle on a sunny Saturday morning, thanks to my coffee passport! I was excited to check it out, as I do not make it to Troy Hill that often and I very much love this part of Pittsburgh. It's so unique and special... so when you visit Pear and the Pickle, make sure you make time to also check out the neighborhood! I went with an almond milk latte and Brendan ordered their drip coffee. He liked his coffee and I enjoyed my latte as well. I also ordered a 6 inch troy hill turkey sandwich to go- it was delicious. The pickles, the peppers, the cracked turkey piled high and the garlic aioli.. it was super tasty and filling. Their menu is quite large and they have something for everyone- gluten free, vegetarian, vegan, whatever! The cafe is much larger than I expected- there is a ton of seating throughout the cafe, making it a good spot to get work done or study. I love the wall of books in the back- it was a lot of fun to go through them while waiting for my order. Overall, I really enjoyed this place- it's definitely a gem in Troy Hill and I am excited to come back!

Y6OJDxVhHy59_w_UbaozAA.text: What a darling spot to find tucked away in a neighborhood full of history!  I had no plans to end up here,but thanks to a major back-up on the roadways, and the pouring rain, I opted to take an alternate route.  Thanks to Yelp, I realized I was in the same area Pear and Pickle was located.  Definitely a seize the moment decision for me, so I decided to stop.  What a cozy, and very welcoming encounter you experience as you enter into the doorway.  I love the decor and that comforting vibe it gives off. Too quaint!  One can't go wrong with the menu options they offer either.   Breakfast, salads, soups or sandwiches are freshly prepared.  I like being able to put together my own meat , cheese and topping pairings if I want something other than their signature sandwiches. Coffee and tea is available as well.  Pear and Pickle is a great place to experience on a regular  basis.   Not only did I enjoy my lunch, but I learned a little history as well.   The name Pear and Pickle traces back to the time when there were pear orchards growing nearby, and when the neighborhood had connections with the local Heinz Pickle plant.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

lTmoBY8aCB9pddkeUcN_KQ.text: I walked up to Pear and the Pickle and saw a gold  pear as their logo and thought... these guys get it.   The whole place was gold!   Not literally.   Figuratively.   I went on a Saturday morning and got a breakfast sandwich and a cup of drip coffee. I ordered a sausage, egg, and cheese on a brioche (I think) ("I think" there is about the brioche, not the type of sandwich as a whole. It's important I make that clear because the sausage egg and cheese was not forgettable. It was memorable. The bun was too. So, don't let this confuse you either. I just don't always know the proper names of breads. It's my fault, not the shop's. The taste...the taste I'll never forget.)(Thanks for allowing me to clarify).   Best breakfast sandwich I've had in the city. Mark it.   The coffee was okay, not the greatest I've ever had. It's okay. You also get a refill on the mug of drip. I'll go back to try espresso.   The inside was incredible and the design style was something that should attract people. It's like Ace Hotel styling. Trendy. Cozy. But artsy. They put a lot of thoughtful work into the space, and I appreciate that in an independently owned business.   The owner took the time to introduce himself and to give a history of the business, their journey, and their ability to pivot based on customer needs. They started wanting a heavy lean on coffee -  coffee shop that sold some food. But the pivot has occurred where they're a food place that sells some coffee. I think there's still some figuring out to be done there, but you can tell an honest person who wants to improve and add value to a community when you meet him/her. Pear and the Pickle ownership is in that category.   There are some random groceries sold in the space to pay homage to the building and what it was as a general store. Awesome once you know - yet confusing to see random items when walking in.   It truly was a great experience. They have a nice deck I want to try once the nuclear winter passes. It's good for conversations, and I'm not sure I would come with my laptop to post-up and work. That would be weird, I think. A breakfast date or a get-together with friends, on the other hand... perfect!   What's ironic is you'd be in a pickle if you didn't go to Pear and the Pickle...and you would also be in one once you got in there. But the latter is what you really want over the former!!

EMQ_VzvURZAekLGEhimEbQ.text: Customer service was less than favorable. The barista was unpleasant as well. My rating is purely on the customer service.

0CwnS3AvJLWJhIJI1Ke35w.text: After hearing good things about this cafe, I ventured up the hill to give it a try this weekend and I was not disappointed. The space, which used to be an old hardware store, was so inviting. The long wooden counter with fresh cookies and croissants and the menu of items listed all looked and sounded so delicious. My husband and I split a breakfast sandwich and a lunch sandwich and both were so good. Everything was quality and the staff was so helpful.   The tables available for seating were mismatched with various different chairs pulled up to them, but it worked so well. It was so cute. They had 3 small rooms downstairs, and upstairs led to a neat patio that I will be coming back to sit on during the warmer months! I can't wait to return and try some more delicious things.

OMpJcXqbdWZ_xRl5B_GN_w.text: Pear and Pickle is the best part of living in Troy Hill. The coffee is delicious, the sandwiches are loaded (I recommend The Rialto) and it has a great atmosphere for dining in. Also, the staff is very nice!

gg_iBHdGd2qrZK19pyq5mw.text: This place is unique to Pittsburgh and I'm glad I finally got to try it. I came here on a Tuesday morning with my girlfriend for a coffee and breakfast sandwich. I kept reading reviews and saw that seemed to be the most popular menu item.   I ordered a regular coffee the sausage breakfast sandwich and added tomatoes. I questioned adding the tomatoes because they were 50 cents extra? Who charges extra for 3 slices of small tomatoes? Were they organic or were they a rare tomato grown out back? I just don't see the point in up charging for something like that. The sausage on the sandwich was just a regular patty. Nothing I'd never had before. It wasn't fresh homemade sausage, it was probably something prepackaged (excuse me if I'm wrong.) I was not impressed. If you're going to ask someone to pay 6 bucks for a breakfast sandwich then meat should (all) be fresh.   My total was $10 and some change.  For a coffee and sandwich it was ten bucks? I'm sorry but that's over priced. My coffee was also forgotten about and there was maybe 3 people in the shop. I went up to the counter to get it and the owner went to get some and they were out. He asked if I would just have an Americana and I'm not picky so I was fine with it.   Who runs out of coffee at a coffee shop when there are only 3-4 patrons inside?  I'm happy I came to try out a new local spot but I'd probably not return.

fctFJWb0qZs4_6qajTl5rw.text: We visited this cafe after purchasing the Pittsburgh coffee passport. It is a very unique location, great food and great coffee. The staff was friendly we will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

w73NPUhT3oc5G9EFIndJMA.text: Clean, open atmosphere. Delicious sandwich with some of the best seitan we've ever had! So flavorful and not fried and oily. The 12 inch was enough for 2 of us to share. For dessert we had a heavenly Blueberry Buckle. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hHI02zQhgOqQqS6xbRTqpA.text: I'm excited to try other items from this delightful market. As I entered, I was welcomed with the sights of many people enjoying their food, cute vintage signage and stylish people working hard behind the counter. I knew this place was going to be good just based on my first impression of it.   Everything is super kitschy here and really fits the  vintage vibe. This place is incredibly welcoming and not at all pretentious. I think the owners really knew how to craft a feel good, neighborhood destination. If I lived closer, I could see myself going here at least once or twice a week.   Regarding the food, I ordered the grilled chicken sandwich and it did not disappoint. The garlic aioli inside definitely makes the sandwich. They do not skimp on the proteins here! My sandwich was generously packed with the highest quality fillings. Everything tasted fresh and delicious. The chicken was perfectly cooked, very tender and dense. The bread that housed all the ingredients was the most perfect texture. It was slightly crispy around the edges however, towards the middle, it was fluffy and spongey. I typically never order grilled chicken sandwiches because I prefer my chicken fried. If I could choose a grilled chicken sandwich from here or a fried chicken sandwich from anywhere else, I would choose the grilled chicken. It's that good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Whimsical beverage case
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cute signage

akcNZPC372ap1OUvIEGhrw.text: Pear and the Pickle is a charming breakfast place with good coffee and breakfast offerings. Their Blueberry Buckle is a great take on regular coffee cake, and their breakfast sandwiches can definitely cure a hangover. It gets a bit crowded closer to noon to make sure to come before or after then!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Egg and cheese sandwich
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blueberry Buckle (Blueberry coffee cake) and two coffees

WtE7XMjtG7EfO2lXZOUw8w.text: I don't know what it was about this sandwich or what made it so great but it had to be the best breakfast sandwich I ever had. I just had the egg tomato and Gouda cheese but dang! So good! The bun was a tiny bit sweet maybe? I can't wait to go back

TDmDK9PVKyvBeXuGjm4tKg.text: I have been dying to come to this place. I follow them on IG and everything they post looks amazing. I ventured there this morning hoping to be able to get some breakfast and spend a few hours studying. I think everyone else must of had the same idea because it was crowded! I ended up getting my breakfast sammy and coffee to go.   Sandwich was good! No complaints. I got the sausage egg and American cheese. Taste and size matched the price. Cheese was gooey and abundant, just the way I like it.   This place definitely has a hip feel. If I lived closer I'd probably come again.   Parking kind of a pain - I was lucky enough to find a spot. It's street parking, so you better know how to parallel park.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast sandwich - egg, sausage, American cheese.

cK2rQ8nfwqdKSF-3hfcLWg.text: After a steep drive up Rialto street, you will find a somewhat small but cozy cafe filled with some of the best food around. This was probably one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had. It had the perfect amount of grease (in a good way!) and blending of textures and flavors. The bun had been buttered and was soft to the touch with just a little crunch from the grill. The meat had been clearly hand pressed- not a frozen patty- and the egg and cheese melted together. Since it was basically the size of a burger, it kept me full for most of the day!   There are three rooms in Pear and the Pickle with varied seating, each gets a little quieter as you go. Seems like a great place to get your morning coffee or have a (small) book club. They had some board games in the last room.  I will note that it did take about 20 minutes for our sandwiches to come out which felt a little long. I have not tried other items on their menu but I would return for this sandwich alone!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

TR2WQVlIo9DlwPMNxy8XDA.text: Aside from having to traverse one of the steepest streets I've encountered to get here, the location was rather charming! Easy to find and easy to park. As is True with most breakfast spots in PGH, bagels are (apparently) hard to come by, but I was still a little surprised when my breakfast sandwich came out on a potato bread roll. Otherwise, my obviously fresh sandwich was delicious and included some very thick slices of bacon, well melted cheese, and a perfectly grilled diner fresh egg. I saw the benefit of going on a weekday, as the place was close to empty with adequate seating and spaces to work or socialize. While they played decent music in the shop, it was much too loud to allow for much conversation. I suspect this changes or is overwhelming during the weekends or when the shop is much busier.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on a potato roll
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast sandwich

l2Ct5NImcI07qSOSlCJjQQ.text: The best way I can put this place -- it's like going to grandmas house. First, it helped that my grandma lived on the top of a steep hill and this place is such, but besides that -- the food tastes great, hearty, and made with a little extra love. (Might that love be butter, sure).  I had some Blueberry bread and a breakfast sandwich with sausage (haven't had sausage that fresh in awhile), tomato, and Swiss. I've got an appetite and I almost debated leaving a bit of the sandwich on my plate -- only because it was filling. This certainly isn't your health food stop, but a nice treat for a long week. Solid coffee... kicked-back, relaxing atmosphere.  I'll be back when I'm looking to slow life down a bit.

TUO2TiVlkK6TShD9-r4zZQ.text: You may have to trek up an incredibly steep hill to get here, but it is well worth it. Especially if you're not on foot or driving a stick shift (HOW would  someone ever survive?!).  As an out of towner, this isn't the most likely of venues, but I'm glad my research led me to the best breakfast sandwich in town. Truly. The staff is friendly and the place is adorable with a little model city in the corner and rows of comet on the market shelves.   Come for the breakfast sandwich and cozy up with your coffee for a while, especially on a drizzly fall day.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Breakfast sandwich of my dreams

FwzqmiQHHCByMPp_TfGC4g.text: The barrista has no sense of urgency,no such thing as a quick cup of coffee here. I arrived at 10:29 did not get my name called until 11:02 that's ridiculous.

eulxHcdc41JnOGo_UtZKmw.text: Nice little cafe and market to hang out in or grab a quick bite to eat.  The inside is nice little place with a back dining area if the front is full or you want a little more quiet time.  It is bright and sunny with a lot of windows in the front.  There are boardgames, newspapers and books to help you relax and enjoy.  Or you can just be working on your computer.   It was busy when we stopped in with a few on computers and a few couples at tables just enjoying the coffee and each others company.   I really wanted to try the homemade soup that I had been told about on this cold day, but alas, no soup today.  I decided on a breakfast sandwich and had the sausage, egg, and a selection of some delectable cheese.  It was great!  The staff was friendly and brought our orders to our table.  If you are in the area, stop by.

WXpOYiDIPMf9jjoJZUM5ZQ.text: Oh my! Still drooling over my Egg+Cheese sandwich from #pearandpickle - I  was in town for work and this place was recommended by a friend and it was incredible! If you haven't been, CHECK IT OUT! Awesome vibes and awesome food super cute decor, great coffee, customer said they had the best cookies "in the world" so naturally I had to try. I was not disappointed! May have found my new coffee spot  #eatlocal #pghfood

2QfBqCaExjIYuFGrsqV97A.text: I have been wanting to try Pear and the Pickle for so long now. I would always forget about it till it was too late or when I had other plans. I very recently had some free time on a Saturday so I decided to check it out.  We got there around 1pm so most of the breakfast options were sold out already. I ended up only being able to get the egg and cheese sandwich without meat. Absolutely no complaints because it was delicious! You could tell it was made fresh. It was probably one of the best breakfast sandwiches I've had since Eggslut in Vegas. It may become of my favorite breakfast spots. I look forward to coming back and trying a sandwich with bacon or sausage.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Dvex6xdWRUKo72PFp3i8yw.text: I love love love it here. As a former New Yorker, I don't go home and get a BEC anymore because it's so, so much better at Pear and the Pickle. There's just something about their fresh sliced bacon smothered with cheese atop a fried egg on a potato bun that makes me drool thinking about it. If I'm being honest, I've never been able to bring myself to try anything else because it's just so damn good. They serve Stumptown coffee if you're into that sort of thing. The road to get their is a steep and narrow hill but there's typically parking in the surrounding neighborhood.

EObn6v0yB_UMcd6rehZBZg.text: Showed up at 11:50 AM on a Sunday where they were supposed to be open until 2pm. We walked in and the place was packed but they had posted "summer vacation starts at 12noon" and refused to take our order. "Sorry, we've taken our last order for the day." Oh, but you will happily make to-go coffees for other people. If you're not closed when we walk in, the least you could do is offer us the chance to order from a small subset of quick to-go items. Shockingly inhospitable and not at all the friendly Pittsburgh vibe I would've expected. If you're that unable to serve someone at 11:50 AM, just don't bother opening for the day. Steer clear of this place, you might encounter the same rude treatment.

pMP24TgXhwxEmixYzTGjKA.text: If you have not been to the Pear and Pickle you should even if its just to come visit their neighborhood which is Troy Hill and come on don't be scared to drive up or down Rialto Street which is a steep experience all by its self. I love the looks of this place its so vintage is the only way to describe it  front is the girl a few tables and a few household items the use of the name Market in the title is stretching it a bit thought they do have laundry soap and a few canned items ...its not really a market though it does look like it might have once been back rooms are cozy places with a big table and a vintage built in china cabinet they have books to enjoy and games to play  ok on to the food I fondly remember my first visit I had a really good latte and a blueberry buckle its a nice slice of dense cake  their lattes are always spot on  I have also visited and had an egg and cheese sammie and ohhh boy was it good...ok so here was my dilemma on my recent visit with 2 friends that had not been there before I was going to order a egg and cheese sammie and noticed the roll package from Mancini bread. FYI Mancini is local my issue is they put lard in their bread I am pescatarian ( I eat fish and dairy) lard in bread is not an expected ingredient in bread or rolls (at least not with out warning) yup that egg sammie was indeed good but I wish I had known then about the lard so this last visit I had a great latte and a crisp chocolate cookie they have a sandwich menu and I have had a soup there too  everyone is very friendly and they apologized ...it seems all their breads are from Mancini if that is not an issue for you then you must try their Sammies  I always find parking on the street

tbvtHIJcI0F7PpT_MRfIag.text: This place is soooo cute! Many people recommended it and we were in Troy Hill anyways, so opted for a later lunch on Saturday. The spot reminds me of an old country store. I ordered a portobello sandwich, a special for the day. Hubs got a Troy Hill turkey and we both had ice teas. It came out to under $30.  Now, the food was amazing! My sandwich had a layer of pesto that was next to the cheese making for a very mixture. The roasted peppers were quite in as well. Not realizing how liberal the sandwiches were, the 12 inch turkey is large enough for two people. Hubs wasn't able to finish it, though tried he did. They didn't hold back at all on the turkey or greens. Quite tasty.  The people working here are so friendly! They didn't turn people away and let those who ordered closer to closing stay and eat. It's a kind gesture.   The treats look tasty and I might be back just for those items!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. So cute!

HFcZ5nf_MR1MVDGotWatxA.text: I love this restaurant! It brings back SO many memories of my childhood. I grew up just a couple doors away, and we would come here to buy penny candy and occasionally pick up cottage cheese for my mother. It has the same good vibe. When they renovated the restaurant, they retained much of the old architecture and furniture. Nostalgia extraordinaire!  Bobby and "his people" are very welcoming and his food is very good and reasonably priced. I value cleanliness, and this restaurant is always neat and clean. I encourage people to try this place. It has great atmosphere to hang and be with friends and have a good bite to eat. I highly recommend Pear and the Pickle :-)

kd7a6xN19DGD0VI7au2olA.text: This Pear and Pickle Cafe is just so darn charming!  We took some out of town guests here for brunch and they loved how quaint and adorable this little cafe is.  You order your meal and coffee at the counter and the staff will deliver it to your table.  We all ordered the breakfast sandwich which was a fresh bun, topped with egg, sausage or bacon, and your cheese of choice served on mismatched china.  The cafe isn't very big so you may have to share a table with other guests, which is what we did, but is totally fine in my book.  I will say that our sandwiches took a little while to get because there was only one chef, but he was very nice and apologetic about it.  I would definitely recommend meeting a friend here for brunch, lunch, coffee or all three!  Such a fun little place to catch up with people.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Such a cute space!
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh flowers on every table
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fresh flowers on every table

BCtJ1KgK5uZbKe4Qu28VTA.text: Such a cute little place in a much needed area! I can't wait to try more on the menu. Sandwiches are fresh and made to order.

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

_bsIyEZ1eRJCywg-Ame4OA.text: I stopped by here earlier today with my wife for our morning coffee.  While I had wanted to head to the Pear and Pickle for awhile, I hadn't made it.  Thankfully it happened to be on the Pittsburgh Coffee Passport which gave me that little extra nudge that I needed to visit.  The inside of this place is neat as it feels old school.  What I mean by that is that it has the feel of an old general store.  So lots of old darkish wood and then there are still shelves that used to hold the products.  Don't let that fool you into thinking it is cold and uninviting as it is exactly the opposite, warm and friendly.  For coffee on this morning I went with a 12 oz latte while my wife went with the 16 oz cold brew.  We also decided to split a sandwich and so we went with the egg sandwich with 3 pepper cheese and then added some bacon.  Our coffees came out first and whenever I tried my latte I thought that the coffee part was a little bitter.  However it really worked well with the milk which smoothed it out and made it much more pleasant.  My wife's cold brew ended up being quite good as the coffee was rich, strong and smooth.  After we had both tried our coffees the egg sandwich was ready and man did it look good with the cheese visibly melted.  It tasted as good as it looked with the egg being done nicely and the pepper cheese being ooey and gooey with a nice little kick to boot.  I am normally one to complain about buns that aren't completely toasted like this one, but I believe in this instance that it worked well.  It had a somewhat buttery flavor to it and held together to the end even though my wife and I had cut the sandwich to split it.  The bottom line for me is that I would be back again in the future.  My wife and I both really loved the feel of this place and thought that the coffee and food were good too!

photos.caption: Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Egg sandwich with three pepper cheese and bacon
Photo of Pear and the Pickle - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 12 oz latte and 16 oz cold brew

8dGpgkfS5EMk5vKXDs0uUQ.text: What a great place. There were 7 of us and we were all thrilled with the great food. The sandwiches and salad were perfect. It is also a great looking place. Bobby the owner and his chef both made us feel so welcome. Next time we are in Pittsburgh we are all going there again. 5 stars for sure.

mKGr6ZJRnFHW61ojECBugQ.text: I went here yesterday and I would definitely recommend it to anyone in search of breakfast or a cool study spot.   I ordered a cold brew coffee and a breakfast sandwich, both of which were fantastic. I was skeptical at first because the price for a sausage egg and cheese was more pricey than what I'm used to, and the bread used was just a regular hamburger bun.    However, it was really delicious. These people know how to make a good breakfast sandwich. Its definitely not what I was expecting, (two sausage patties and the addition of tomato), but it all worked together nicely and tasted great.  Street parking is also very easy to find, unlike in other parts of the city, which is a nice perk.   I will definitely be back soon!

N-6Q7dNL2WcrRrbr87pomQ.text: A great cafe with delicious coffee and incredible breakfast sandwiches that are fresh and made to order. The place has a real community-integrated vibe and Bobby is super friendly. We are delighted to make this our neighborhood go-to and have quickly become regulars.

9raXLfccXzt0yzgNwb6uOw.text: The tl;dr version of this review: darn good coffee + lots of windows + reading room/nook. Out once more on the quest to find new coffee haunts around the 'Burgh, I made my way up to Troy Hill to check out Pear and the Pickle. I was pleasantly surprised to find a beautiful area with lots of space and tables of all sizes to choose from. I enjoyed a Stumptown (!!) coffee in addition to a breakfast sandwich, which was made to order on a Mancini's bun with crisp bacon, egg, and a generous slice of pepper jack cheese. Service was not the most welcoming to start (hence the 4 stars), but I did receive an apology for the wait on the breakfast sandwich--though I gotta say, it was just about worth it. The market portion is cute and could be handy to pick up any pantry staples you might be short on. This would be a nice spot to meet friends for breakfast or lunch, and I hope to come back soon to do just that.

10J70aOQH8SzGY7aU_RuKA.text: Really just a lovely place to spend time.  Tucked away on a mostly residential street in Troy Hill, Pickle and Pear has served me some of the best simple cafe food I've ever had.  As I'm writing this, I'm searching the library wall for a new book, eating probably the finest breakfast sandwich of my existence.  The perfect model of a low key neighborhood cafe and eatery.  The details really reflect the spirit of the neighborhood, making this place feel like it's been here forever.  Well done!

n-M337fD3RszWviFB6rK0A.text: Pear and the Pickle is one of our favorite spots in town. As other reviews say, it has the best breakfast sandwich in Pittsburgh. The food has all of the quality of other fantastic eats in Pittsburgh with none of the pretentiousness surrounding it. The space is nice and relaxing, and the staff has always treated us incredibly well. It's become a regular stop for us, and I would highly recommend heading up to Troy Hill to check it out.

oe8fabS_jXej4PvqXIYbRA.text: My husband and I went there for lunch and it was delicious. I had the turkey sandwich and my husband had pastrami. They're very big sandwiches and they serve great coffee. Very friendly service. My husband has been back several times and loves it. Definitely recommend

9ljv316mVi7OFMUFgB2HdQ.text: I'm a breakfast-sandwich addict, so imagine my delight to discover during a visit to Pittsburgh earlier this week that this pleasant venue has the best bacon-and-egg sandwiches in town -- well, maybe even the state. Nice job. Stumptown coffee, too. A little out of the way but worth the detour, especially for the friendly owner and neighborhood vibe.

XYdAjaqNxQ6dgQC8JTsPOQ.text: Best breakfast sandwiches in the burgh. Delicious bacon, egg and cheese on a Mancini's roll. Deli meats are very affordable and top quality!

15mK6yJb7BL3R6JF8Qu0qA.text: Stopped here for lunch - we both had breakfast sandwiches. I had the Egg and Sausage - my husband had the Egg and Bacon. The sandwiches were delicious - hot, cheesy and the breakfast meat was excellent. Very substantial breakfast sandwich - definitely worth the price. The Stumptown coffee is great - no bitter taste like some of the gourmet coffees can have, Looking forward to trying the hoagies - They carry Boar's Head meats and cheeses which are the best. They also have Leona's Ice cream sandwiches - I am going to stop to get a couple of those! Cute interior and friendly staff completed the positive experience.

AUKlEKrD4VdKviHvovNyuw.text: brooklyn------D  pittsburgh.  troy hill facade, silver lake interiour.  boar's head, coffee, cool breakfast menu.  all nice touches, super thought through (it seems).  a great choice in a sneaky cool neighborhood.
